testID-001.title: Presence of non-visually labeled fields
testID-001.detail: All form elements must have a visible label.
testID-001.solution: Set up a visible relevant label for each field

testID-005.title: A data format is missing
testID-005.detail: A data format is necessary to allow all users to correctly enter informations.
testID-005.solution: Add a data format. This format is programmatically linked to the field.
testID-005.technicalSolution:
Apply one of the solutions below: - integrate the data format into the label element example: - link the format to the field via an attribute aria-describedby exemple:

Input format: DD/MM/YYYY

testID-067.title: Presence of fields not linked to their labels
testID-067.detail: All label tags must be linked to the corresponding field.
testID-067.solution: The label tag must have a for attribute pointing to the id of the corresponding input

testID-067.title: Presence of unlabeled fields
testID-067.detail: All form elements must have an accessible name.
testID-067.solution:
Apply one of the solutions below:
- add a "label" element, in masking accessible if necessary, programmatically linked to the field
- use an aria-labelledby pointing to relevant information to understand the nature of the field 
- addition of an aria-label attribute
- addition of a title attribute
testID-067.technicalSolution: Examples: - - < h2 id="idHeading">[…] - -

testID-067.title: The data format is not programmatically linked to the field
testID-067.detail: The data format will not be perceived by an assistive technology (example: screen reader) when there is not a explicit link with the field.
testID-067.solution: Add a data format. This format is programmatically linked to the field.
testID-067.technicalSolution:
Apply one of the solutions below: - integrate the data format into the label element example: - link the format to the field via an attribute aria-describedby exemple:

Input format: DD/MM/YYYY

testID-002.title: Presence of irrelevant field labels
testID-002.detail: All form elements must have a relevant label, allowing to understand the purpose of the field.
testID-002.solution: Complete the text of the label.

testID-003.title: Presence of non-grouped fields
testID-003.detail: When necessary the fields of same nature must be grouped
testID-003.solution:
- apply a "fieldset" completed by an element "legend" 
 - apply a role "group" on the parent element encapsulating the fields, and complete with a legend based on an aria-labelledby

testID-004.title: Mandatory field not visually identifiable
testID-004.detail: The visual identification of the mandatory field is not based only on color.
testID-004.solution: Add visual information not based only on color, example: asterisk, icon…

testID-004.title: Mandatory field not identifiable programmatically
testID-004.detail: The identification of a mandatory field is not possible for assistive technologies (ex. : screen reader), if it is not given programmatically.
testID-004.solution:
Use one of the techniques below: 
 - visual information integrated into the label 
- addition of a "required" attribute on the input 
 - addition of an "aria-required" attribute on the input

testID-012.title: No autocomplete attribute for fields presenting personal data
testID-012.detail: Any field used to collect specific data on the user must have an "autocomplete" attribute.
testID-012.solution: Add an "autocomplete" attribute on the input. The value of the autocomplete depends on the nature of the information collected in the field.

testID-006.title: Some error messages are not perceived by users
testID-006.detail: Error messages must be perceived by all users, whatever the equipment used
testID-006.solution:
Apply one of the following techniques :
- Error message is displayed before the form.
- The message displays the list of error fields.
 Focus is positioned on the error message container.
- Anchors allow users to go to fields on error.
- Error messages are displayed in field labels.
- Error messages are not displayed in field labels but a mechanism exists to link fields and errors by a programmatic mean: see aria-describedby or aria-labelledby.

testID-006.title: Some fields on error are not perceived by users
testID-006.detail: Fields on error must be perceived by all users, whatever the equipment used.
testID-006.solution: Use aria-invalid="true" attibute in the fields to tell assistive technologies which fields are in error.

testID-007.title: No error messages
testID-007.solution: Error messages allow users to easily detect input errors. Implement a form validation system to detect and display relevant and explicit error messages

testID-007.title: Error messages are not explicit enough
testID-007.detail: The error messages are not explicit enough to determine the nature of the error.
testID-007.solution: Explicit error messages allow users to easily detect and correct errors. Provide a specific message depending on the nature of the error.

testID-007.title: Form with errors are not identifiable
testID-007.detail: The error messages do not identify the form in error.
testID-007.solution: The error message must make it possible to identify the field in error. The message must use the label of the form.

testID-008.title: No suggestions for corrections
testID-008.detail:
When fields are in error, suggestions for corrections should be offered if necessary. For example:
 - Suggestion from a limited set of values
 - Additional help to correct incorrectly formatted input .
testID-008.solution: Propose suggestions for corrections adapted to the field and the type of error made

testID-077.title: An authentication has only a cognitive test
testID-077.detail: It is not possible to connect other than with a cognitive test
testID-077.solution:
Another authentication technique must be present and not rely on a cognitive test, for example: 
- email authentication 
- login using oAuth 
- fields are properly marked up allowing them to be filled in automatically

testID-009.title: Important data is submitted without the possibility of being canceled or verified
testID-009.detail: Users should be in control when submitting important data (legal commitment, financial transaction, modifying or deleting important data, answers to a test or exam…).
testID-009.solution:
Apply one of the solutions below:
 - The action can be undone
 - a confirmation step allowing verification or modification is present before final validation
testID-009.technicalSolution:
Example:
 After submitting the form, a confirmation message appears in a popin.
 The message includes the data entered by the user, and gives the possibility to validate or cancel.
 If the user cancels, he is redirected to the form, his entries are still present in the fields, with the possibility of modifying them.

testID-017.title: Page title not specified
testID-017.detail: Each page should have a unique title.
testID-017.solution: Fill in the <title> element, with keywords allowing to understand the role of the page. The information can be ordered from the most specific to the least specific, or vice versa (no rules).

testID-017.title: Page title irrelevant
testID-017.detail: Each page must have a unique title, making it possible to understand its role.
testID-017.solution: Fill in the <title> element, with keywords allowing to understand the role of the page. The information can be ordered from the most specific to the least specific, or vice versa (no rules).

testID-017.title: Page title not modified when submitting the form
testID-017.detail: Each page must have a unique title, allowing to have information on the validation or not of the form of the page when this one does not imply page change.
testID-017.solution: Fill in the <title> element with keywords to understand the role of the page and, dynamically, the validation status of the form. The information must indicate if the form is in error, if it has been validated…
testID-017.technicalSolution: <title>Subscribed to the newsletter - Home - Orange customer area</title>

testID-010.title: Incomplete hierarchy
testID-010.detail: The page must be structured with headings.
testID-010.solution: All content, visually treated as titles, must have heading semantics (<h1> to <h6> tags)

testID-010.title: Hierarchy of heading levels not logical
testID-010.detail: Level headings should be ranked logically

testID-083.title: Level headings are irrelevant.
testID-083.detail:
Level headings should be relevant and accurately describe the section of content they feature.
 Headings within the same level cannot have the same name.

testID-084.title: Incomplete hierarchy
testID-084.detail: The page must be structured using level headings.
testID-084.solution: All the contents of the page must have a title (tags <h1> to <h6>) which describes them

testID-068.title: A HTML list semantic is missing
testID-068.detail: Items presented visually as lists must be structured with list semantics.
testID-068.solution: Use appropriate list semantics <ul>, <ol> or <dl>, <dt> and <dd>.

testID-068.title: An HTML hyperlink semantic is missing
testID-068.detail: Interactive elements causing a URL change must use HTML an hyperlink semantics.
testID-068.solution: Use a <a> tag with a href attribute.

testID-068.title: A HTML button semantic is missing
testID-068.detail: Interactive elements that trigger an action must use HTML button semantics.

testID-068.title: Inversion of button/link semantics
testID-068.detail: A button is not a link and/or vice versa.
testID-068.solution:
A button acts within the same page (opening a modal, sorting or filtering results, etc.) while a link changes URL (intra-page anchor, page change, etc.).
 Use <button> tags or <input type="button"> for buttons and the <a> tag for links.

testID-068.title: Text without semantics
testID-068.detail: Textual content is not included in a semantic tag. Without appropriate semantics, a text has no meaning in the structure of the document for technical assistance users.
testID-068.solution:
Add the appropriate semantic structure to textual content, for example, a paragraph

, a quote ,

… Note:
and are not semantic tags

testID-021.title: The lang attribute is missing
testID-021.detail: A lang attribute must be present on the HTML element. In addition, the value of the attribute must correspond to the main language of the document.

testID-021.title: The value of the lang attribute is wrong
testID-021.detail: The value of the attribute must match the main language of the document.
testID-021.solution: If english is the main language of the document, then the value of the attribute will be lang="en"

testID-022.title: Language change not indicated
testID-022.detail: Words and expressions in foreign languages ​​must be indicated to users.
testID-022.solution: Add a lang attribute to foreign language terms

testID-023.title: Row or column headers semantics are missing
testID-023.detail: Headers are required to identify the nature of the columns and / or rows
testID-023.solution: The column header cells must have a semantics of TH + a scope="col" attribute. Row header cells must have a semantics of TH + a scope="row" attribute.

testID-023.title: Presence of a layout table
testID-023.detail: Tables should not be used content layout
testID-023.solution: Add a role="presentation" to the table

testID-013.title: An ALT attribute is missing
testID-013.detail: All images must have an ALT attribute.
testID-013.solution: Add an ALT attribute to images.

testID-013.title: The ALT attribute of an image within a link is not filled in or not relevant
testID-013.detail: The content of the ALT attribute of each clickable images is relevant to its linking function.
testID-013.solution: Enter the link target in the ALT

testID-013.title: The ALT attribute of an image that carrying information is not filled in or not relevant
testID-013.detail: The alt attribute of each image is relevant to the role of the image on the page.
testID-013.solution: Enter in the ALT the information carried by the image.

testID-013.title: The ALT attribute of an image containing text is not filled in or not relevant
testID-013.detail: The ALT attribute includes at least the text of the image.
testID-013.solution: Enter, at least, in the ALT the text displayed in the image.

testID-013.title: The ALT attribute of a decorative image is not relevant
testID-013.detail: The ALT attribute of a decorative image must be empty, so that the image is ignored by assistive technologies.

testID-013.title: The ALT of a complex image (diagrams, graphs, etc.) is irrelevant
testID-013.solution: For any image description that is too long to be put in an ALT attribute, the description of the images is either present in the page, or, an adjacent link points to an html page containing the description.

testID-013.title: The aria-hidden attribute of a decorative SVG tag is not present
testID-013.detail: A decorative SVG image (tag) must have an aria-hidden="true" attribute and a focusable="false" attribute
testID-013.solution: Add aria-hidden and focusable attributes in the element's SVG tag.

testID-013.title: An informative SVG image has no alternative text
testID-013.detail: In the case of an SVG tag containing an informative image, the
testID-013.solution: Add either an ALT attribute or a relevant aria-label attribute to the SVG tag.
testID-013.technicalSolution: Example of a tag with an image in .svg format To know more : https://a11y-guidelines.orange.com/en/articles/accessible-svg/

testID-062.title: Presence of text as an image
testID-062.detail: Texts must be included in HTML and formatted via CSS.
testID-062.solution: Include texts in HTML and manage the formatting via CSS.

testID-014.title: An alternative to Captcha is missing or incorrect
testID-014.detail: An alternative to Captcha doest not tell the user it is a Captcha
testID-014.solution: Put a valid textual alternative for this image, example: "CAPTCHA (image anti-spam)" .

testID-015.title: An alternative to Captcha is missing
testID-015.detail: Any captcha that is only visual or audio must have an accessible alternative.
testID-015.solution: Provide as an alternative: an audio and visual Captcha, or logical tests (question whose answer is obvious, simple mathematical test…).

testID-065.title: A TITLE attribute is missing
testID-065.detail: All frames must have a TITLE attribute to describe their role.
testID-065.solution: Add a TITLE attribute to frames.

testID-065.title: No relevant TITLE on frames (iframe)
testID-065.detail: The frame (iframe) has a TITLE attribute, but this one is not relevant
testID-065.solution: Put a relevant TITLE that represents the function of the frame

testID-024.title: Insufficient contrast between text and background
testID-024.detail: The contrast must be sufficient to understand the information carried by all the texts.
testID-024.solution: Ensure a contrast of 4.5:1 minimum for texts of normal sizes (less than 24px CSS and 19px CSS bold). Ensure a minimum contrast of 3:1 for large texts (greater than 24px CSS and 19px CSS bold).

testID-024.title: Insufficient contrast for non-underlined links
testID-024.detail: Non-underlined links must have a sufficient contrast ratio with the surrounding text.
testID-024.solution: Ensure a minimum contrast of 4.5: 1 between an un-underlined link and the surrounding text of normal sizes (less than 24px CSS and 19px CSS in bold). Ensure a minimum 3: 1 contrast between a non-underlined link and the surrounding text of large sizes (greater than 24px CSS and 19px CSS in bold).

testID-025.title: Only a background or text color is set
testID-025.detail: Either the text color and the background color are defined or none of them is defined

testID-026.title: Insufficient contrast for icons carrying information
testID-026.detail: The contrast must be sufficient to convey the information.
testID-026.solution: Ensure a minimum contrast of 3:1 for icons.

testID-026.title: Insufficient contrast for interactive components (buttons, radio buttons…)
testID-026.detail: The contrast must be sufficient to convey the information.
testID-026.solution: Ensure a minimum contrast of 3:1 for the different interactive components.

testID-026.title: Insufficient contrast for states of interactive components (focus, hover…)
testID-026.detail: The contrast must be sufficient to convey the information.
testID-026.solution: Ensure a minimum contrast of 3:1 for the different states of interactive components.

testID-027.title: Color is the only way to convey information
testID-027.detail: Color should not be the only means of conveying information: at least one other visual means is available to obtain the same information.
testID-027.solution: Complete the color with explicit text, or other visual information (example: icons use colors, but also different shapes).

testID-051.title: Sensory information is the only way to convey information
testID-051.detail: Sensory information (eg: position, size, sound) should not be the only way to provide information.
testID-051.solution: Complete the information with a text, or an explicit message.

testID-011.title: The visible text on the screen is missing in the accessible name
testID-011.detail: The text of the displayed label (the alternative text or the text of the image visible on the screen) must be present (in first position, if possible) in the name (accessible) of this component.
testID-011.solution: Modify the accessible name of the element to include visible text on the screen, if possible in first position.
testID-011.technicalSolution: Several solutions are available to redefine the accessible name: aria-labelledby, aria-label, title, hidden accessible text.

testID-028.title: Presence of link texts that are not understandable in their context
testID-028.detail: The target of a link is not understandable even with its direct context (surrounding text).
testID-028.solution: Add discriminating information in the surrounding text.
testID-028.technicalSolution:
The solution depends on the context in which the element is used: - element in a paragraph: complete the text of the paragraph (

[…]

) - element in a list: complete a item from the list (
    ,
      ) - element in a table cell: complete the text of the cell ( […] ) or complete the direct header of the cell ( […] ).

testID-070.title: Presence of non-explicit links out of context
testID-070.detail: The accessible name of each link should make its purpose clear outside of the page context.
testID-070.solution: Fill in each link accessible name to understand its purpose without referring to the context. Several solutions exist: set up an alternative, modify the link title, add accessible masking text to the title, make the link explicit by adding the context in the link title attribute, use the aria-label or labelledby attribute...

testID-070.title: Presence of several identical link labels with different purposes
testID-070.detail: Several links with similar accessible names point to different pages.
testID-070.solution: Set each link accessible name to make it unique and specific. Some possible solutions: set up an alternative, modify the link title, add accessible masking text to the title, make the link explicit by adding context to the link title attribute, use the aria-label or labelledby attribute...

testID-071.title: Link title does not contain document name
testID-071.detail: User does not know the name of document he is about to open or download
testID-071.solution: Include document name in link text.
testID-071.technicalSolution: Example: Download the full 2020 report (PDF, 1.5 Mo). More details https://a11y-guidelines.orange.com/en/articles/download-links/#valid-examples

testID-071.title: Link title does not indicate document type
testID-071.detail: The user does not know type of document (doc, mp3, pdf, etc.) he is about to open or download.
testID-071.solution: Show document type in link label.
testID-071.technicalSolution: Example: Download the full 2020 report (PDF, 1.5 Mo). More details https://a11y-guidelines.orange.com/en/articles/download-links/#valid-examples

testID-071.title: Link title does not indicate document size
testID-071.detail: Users don't know size of document they are about to open or download.
testID-071.solution: Show document size in link label.
testID-071.technicalSolution: Example: Download the full 2020 report (PDF, 1.5 Mo). More details https://a11y-guidelines.orange.com/en/articles/download-links/#valid-examples

testID-072.title: User not notified when a new window or tab opens
testID-072.detail: The user is not informed that the link triggers the opening of a new window or tab.
testID-072.solution: Notify the user of the opening of any new window by indicating it in the title of the link using the words "(new window)", e.g., "Go to orange.com (new window)".
testID-072.technicalSolution: Go to Orange (New window). More details, see https://a11y-guidelines.orange.com/en/web/develop/common-navigation/#warn-the-user-when-opening-a-new-window

testID-069.title: Presence of irrelevant button labels
testID-069.detail: The action carried by a button is not understandable.
testID-069.solution: Add discriminating information in the text of the buttons.
testID-069.technicalSolution: The accessible name of the button must make it possible to understand its function, all or part of the text can be hidden in an accessible way.

testID-029.title: No section headings
testID-029.detail: There are no section headings that would allow assistive technologies users to directly access the page content and avoid common elements (e.g., main navigation).
testID-029.solution: Use heading levels (h1…) to define the different page sections.

testID-029.title: No skip links
testID-029.detail: Skip links that allow direct access to page content to avoid some page elements.
testID-029.solution: Use skip links at the start of the page (first <body> element) to quickly access certain content on your page (main content, form, etc.).

testID-029.title: No landmarks to structure the page
testID-029.detail: It lacks structure landmarks that would allow users to better understand the page and to be able to skip blocks of content (e.g., going directly to main navigation).
testID-029.solution: Use structure landmarks to define the different page sections (e.g., header, nav, main, article…).

testID-073.title: Missing, incomplete and/or inconsistent global semantic structure
testID-073.detail: In order for the structure of a web page to be correctly rendered by technical assistance (e.g., screen reader) and navigation to be facilitated, the appropriate HTML semantic tags (header, footer, main, aside, etc.) must be correctly used.
testID-073.solution:
Set up semantic HTML tags that have a consistent semantic meaning with their position in the HTML structure and what they contain.
 These tags must be used alone (without the corresponding ARIA roles) because their support is correctly interpreted in the vast majority of browsers and technical assistance
testID-073.technicalSolution:
Structure to use for a page in HTML 5 (for more info, see https://a11y-guidelines.orange.com/en/articles/aria-live-alert/) :
[…]
[…]

content related to the main content

[…]

footer contents : copyright…

[…]

testID-073.title: Content is placed outside of semantic HTML tags
testID-073.detail: All the content of the HTML page must be positioned in semantic tags. No element should be placed outside. Thus, technical assistance (e.g., screen reader) will be able to access the page content and render it intelligibly.
testID-073.solution: Place all the content of the page in semantic HTML tags (header, footer, main, aside, etc.)
testID-073.technicalSolution:
The page content must be entirely placed in a semantic structure (for more info, see https://a11y-guidelines.orange.com/en/articles/aria-live-alert/) :
[…]
[…]

content related to the main content

[…]

footer contents : copyright…

[…]

testID-074.title: No skip links (at the top of the page)
testID-074.detail: The page should contain skip links (at the top of the page) if at least one of the 3 following cases is present: the page is long, the navigation contains a lot of links (several navigation menus, footers acting as a site map, etc.), the page is divided into many distinct parts (portal, dashboard, etc.)
testID-074.solution: Add skip links. They are to be gathered at the top of the page and must allow to access the main regions of the page. Examples: 'Go to menu', 'Go to content', 'Go to search'

testID-074.title: Skip links are present but don't work
testID-074.detail: The page contains skip links, but they are not functional: they do not allow the user to skip part of the page.
testID-074.solution:
Make sure that each skip link works. Therefore, each link must:
 1/ target an HTML element with an id attribute,
 2/ this element is displayed in the viewport (visible area of the page) and take the keyboard focus.

testID-030.title: Cannot move the pointer to the content of a tooltip
testID-030.detail: After opening a tooltip, the user cannot move his pointer from the trigger element to the content of the tooltip, without the latter closing.
testID-030.solution: The user must be able to move the mouse pointer from the trigger element to the content of the tooltip without closing it.

testID-030.title: Cannot close additional content (tooltip, popin…) without moving the focus or the pointer
testID-030.detail: After opening additional content, the user cannot close it without having to move the focus or the mouse pointer.
testID-030.solution: Provide a mechanism for users allowing them to close additional content without moving focus or mouse (e.g. closing with the Esc. key).

testID-031.title: A time limit is not controllable by the user
testID-031.detail: Any time limit should be user controllable.
testID-031.solution: Any time limit must either be removed, or increased up to a minimum of 10 times the default time, or the user is warned at least 20 seconds before the end and can increase the duration merely.

testID-032.title: Open popup or modal on focus of an element
testID-032.detail: On focus, no modal or popup should open.

testID-032.title: Form submitted automatically on focus of an element
testID-032.detail: A form is submitted automatically as soon as a form element takes focus (onFocus).
testID-032.solution: A form should be submitted only after activating the submit button (onClick).

testID-032.title: Change of page content on focus
testID-032.detail: A content change occurs without being initiated by the user (onFocus).
testID-032.solution: A content change must only take place after the user has  activated (onClick) a link or an action button.

testID-032.title: Opening a new page on focus
testID-032.detail: A new page openning (or new tab) occurs without being initiated by the user (onFocus).
testID-032.solution: The openning of a new page (or tab) must only take place after the user has triggered (onClick) on a link.

testID-061.title: Form submitted automatically without explicit user validation
testID-061.detail: A form is submitted automatically without user action.
testID-061.solution: A form should be submitted only after activating the submit button (onClick).

testID-061.title: Form submitted automatically when changing parameters
testID-061.detail: A form is automatically submitted following the modification of the state of a checkbox, a radio button, a choice in a drop-down list...
testID-061.solution: A form should be submitted only after activating the submit button (onClick).

testID-061.title: Form submitted automatically during data entry
testID-061.detail: A form is automatically submitted after entering data in a field (onInput).
testID-061.solution: A form should be submitted only after activating the submit button (onClick).

testID-033.title: Only one navigation mechanism is present
testID-033.detail: At least 2 navigation mechanisms must be present on the pages.
testID-033.solution:
Complete the existing mechanism with a solution listed below: 
 - a main navigation menu 
 - a table of contents 
 - a sitemap 
 - a search mechanism 
 - a list of links to navigate to across the whole site (footer).

testID-075.title: No current user position system
testID-075.detail: The current location of the user must be presented
testID-075.solution: Set up a system allowing to locate the user on the site by one of the following means: a navigation menu presenting the current position of the user, a breadcrumb… See https://www .w3.org/TR/2016/NOTE-WCAG20-TECHS-20161007/G63

testID-075.title: Visual position indication is not contrasted enough
testID-075.detail: The visual position indication is not contrasted enough
testID-075.solution: Adapt sufficient contrast while respecting the 3:1 ratio

testID-075.title: Visual position indication only relies on color
testID-075.detail: Visual position indication is only based on color
testID-075.solution: Implement an additional means to color

testID-075.title: No aria-current attribute
testID-075.detail: A visual position indication is present but whithout the presence of an `aria-current` attribute

testID-034.title: No ARIA roles (status, alert, alertdialog...) or dynamic aria-live regions
testID-034.detail: Alert messages cannot be read by screen readers.
testID-034.solution:
Apply an ARIA role ("status", "alert", "alertdialog", etc...) or an attribute "aria-live" to the alert message to make it automatically vocalized. Examples: " -
[…]
-
[…]
"

testID-034.title: Action in progress is not returned to the user
testID-034.detail: The progression through warning messages is not returned to screen readers.
testID-034.solution:
Apply an ARIA role ("status", "alert", "alertdialog", etc…) or attribute "aria-live" on the alert message so that it is automatically vocalized. Examples: " -
[…]
-
[…]
"

testID-035.title: A mechanism to stop moving content is missing
testID-035.detail: User must have control of moving content.
testID-035.solution: Provide an accessible mechanism to stop or pause moving content.

testID-036.title: Presence of rapid flashing
testID-036.detail: Presence of content presenting rapid flashes (more than 3 flashes per second) or the flashes are below the general threshold or red threshold.

testID-038.title: Presence of keyboard trap
testID-038.detail: Whatever the type of the component, the page or the application, users must be able to access all the content with the keyboard without being trapped.

testID-039.title: User does not have control of a single key based keyboard shortcut
testID-039.detail: The user does not have control of a keyboard shortcut based on a character : letter (lowercase or uppercase), punctuation, number, or symbol character.
testID-039.solution:
The user must be able to:
 - deactivate the shortcut
 - or modify the shortcut to add an extra key to the combination
 - or ensure that the shortcut is active only when taking focus of the component of the interface.

testID-040.title: Non-logical focus sequence
testID-040.detail: The movement of the focus does not follow a logical reading order.

testID-041.title: Focus indicator is displayed but is not visible enough
testID-041.detail: Focus indicator visibility must be sufficient (check contrast and size).
testID-041.solution:
To modify the focus indicator visibility, you could:
Increase the contrast level between the focus indicator and the background color (minimum level 3.1).
Increase the size of the focus indicator by changing the outline CSS properties (e.g., outline:2px).

testID-041.title: Focus indicator (outline CSS property) is disabled
testID-041.detail: The outline must not be disabled.
testID-041.solution: Check that the focus indicator visibility is not disabled in the CSS properties (e.g., outline:none;).

testID-041.title: Use of color only to show focus
testID-041.detail: Color cannot be the only element to distinguish the focus.
testID-041.solution: Set up another way than changing color for the focus indicator (ex.: shape, size, outline, underline...).

testID-041.title: Visualization of the focus is insufficient
testID-041.detail: The contrast of the focus indicator must be sufficiently contrasted (3:1) compare&d with the background of the element
testID-041.solution: Ensure a minimum 3:1 contrast for the different interactive components and the focus indicator.

testID-042.title: Truncated or hidden texts
testID-042.detail: Information lost because of truncated or hidden texts when resizing the page (200% zoom text).
testID-042.solution: To solve these issues, it is recommended to use relative units (e.g., %, em, rem) for texts and parent containers (e.g., div, buttons...).

testID-042.title: Zoom is not allowed
testID-042.detail: The enlargement of the text must be possible on mobile.
testID-042.solution:
If a "<meta name = 'viewport'>" tag is present: 
 - the user-scalable='no' parameter is not present 
 - and the maximum-scale parameter is not less than 2

testID-043.title: Need to scroll horizontally to access information or functions
testID-043.detail: After resizing to 320 px css width, content (informative text or functionality) is hidden and requires horizontal scrolling to be displayed.
testID-043.solution:
- apply relative units (em, rem, %) to text containers 
- or use "min-width" and "min-height" properties instead of "width" and "height" properties.

testID-043.title: Need to scroll vertically to access information or functions
testID-043.detail: After resizing to 256 px css height, content (informative text or functionality) is hidden and requires horizontal scrolling to be displayed.
testID-043.solution:
- apply relative units (em, rem, %) to text containers 
- or use "min-width" and "min-height" properties instead of "width" and "height" properties.

testID-044.title: Presence of truncated or overlapping texts
testID-044.detail: Contents are truncated or overlapped after applying text spacing properties.
testID-044.solution: Do not impose or inherit an absolute size (px…) to the spacing properties.
testID-044.technicalSolution:
- apply relative units (em, rem, %…) to text spacing properties 
 - apply relative units (em, rem, %…) to text containers 
 - or use properties "min-width"and "min-height" instead of the "width"and "height" properties.

testID-045.title: Components repeated on several pages, in different orders
testID-045.detail: Components repeated on several pages, do not appear in the same order on some pages.
testID-045.solution: The layout of the components must be homogeneous between all the pages of a site. Components should appear consistently, in the same relative order.

testID-046.title: Components repeated on several pages, with different titles
testID-046.detail: Components repeated on several pages, do not have the same title (accessible) name.
testID-046.solution: Components repeated on several pages must have homogeneous names.

testID-058.title: Reading order is not understandable after CSS deactivation
testID-058.detail: The reading order should allow content to be understood and used when CSS is disabled on the page
testID-058.solution: The order in which elements appear in the HTML code must allow the page content to be understood and used.

testID-060.title: Informational content is not preserved
testID-060.detail: After disabling CSS, content carrying information should be preserved. CSS-generated content should be only decorative.
testID-060.solution: No information should be contained in CSS properties (::before, ::after, content:...)

testID-060.title: Information-carrying images are embedded in CSS
testID-060.detail: After disabling CSS, images carrying information must be preserved (text images, button icons). CSS-generated content should be decorative only.
testID-060.solution: No information should be contained in CSS properties (::before, ::after, content:...), images carrying information should not be embedded in CSS background properties

testID-047.title: An action based on a complex gesture has no alternative
testID-047.detail: Any action based on complex gestures must have an alternative based on a single pointer usage.
testID-047.solution: Example: for a zoom action on a map with a finger pinch, an alternative in the form of <button> [+] and [-] is proposed.

testID-048.title: An action cannot be undone
testID-048.detail: The action cannot be canceled because it was triggered on the DOWN event.
testID-048.solution:
- trigger the action on the UP event
 - for complex components (eg: drag n'drop), the action on the UP is completed by a dialog box giving users the possibility to cancel their action.

testID-049.title: An action based on a movement of the device or a gesture of the user has no alternative
testID-049.detail: Any action based on a movement of the device must have an alternative.
testID-049.solution: Allow this action to be triggered by another means (eg: add a button in the interface).

testID-050.title: Loss of information during a consultation in portrait or landscape mode
testID-050.detail: Content and functionality must be available in both orientations without loss of information.

testID-050.title: Content display is limited to a single orientation (landscape or portrait)
testID-050.detail: Content cannot be displayed in both available orientations, or a message appears asking to reorient the device.

testID-052.title: A complete transcript is missing
testID-052.detail: A complete transcript (text version of the speech containing all visual and auditory information) must be provided as an alternative to audio or video tracks.
testID-052.solution: Add a complete transcript (text version of the speech containing all visual and auditory information), either directly in the page, or by a link pointing to an html page containing this transcript and this, near the element to be described

testID-053.title: A complete transcript is missing
testID-053.detail: A complete transcript (text version of the speech containing all visual and auditory information) must be provided as an alternative to audio or video tracks.
testID-053.solution: Add a complete transcript (text version of the speech containing all visual and auditory information), either directly in the page, or by a link pointing to an html page containing this transcript and this, near the element to be described

testID-057.title: Audio description is missing
testID-057.detail: Audio description is required for videos presenting information in visual form.
testID-057.solution: Adding an audio description is present in addition to the audio track, if necessary. This presents, in text format, the information conveyed only by the image.

testID-054.title: Captions are missing
testID-054.detail: For any video, captions are available
testID-054.solution: Add captions in text format for all videos. These provide all the informations of the audio track.

testID-056.title: Captions are missing
testID-056.detail: For any video, captions are available
testID-056.solution: Add captions in text formats for all videos. These provide all the informations of the audio track.

testID-063.title: Unable to stop an audio or video track
testID-063.detail: Audio or video tracks that autoplay on the page for longer than 3 seconds must be able to be stopped or paused.
testID-063.solution: Provide an easily reachable and accessible mechanism for users to stop or pause audio (e.g., a link placed at the beginning of the TAB position titled ‘pause video’).

testID-063.title: Unable to mute an audio or video track regardless of the system volume
testID-063.detail: Audio tracks on the page that automatically play longer than 3 seconds must provide a way to mute the sound without being dependent on the system volume.
testID-063.solution: Provide an easily reachable and accessible mechanism for users to control the volume of sounds played for more than 3 seconds (e.g., a link placed at the begining of the TAB position titled 'Mute audio').

testID-066.title: The state of a component is not perceived with a screen reader
testID-066.detail: The states checked / unchecked, folded / unfolded… are not seen with a screen reader
testID-066.solution:
- use native components as a priority (example: use input checkboxes for checkboxes, the state will be managed natively 
 - otherwise make sure to apply the ARIA patterns, to ensure correct semantics and management of the states of the components ( cf. attributes aria-expanded, aria-selected…)

testID-066.title: An interactive component cannot be used with a screen reader
testID-066.detail: The features of a component that cannot be used with a screen reader
testID-066.solution:
- use native components as a priority (example: use input checkboxes for checkboxes, the state will be managed natively 
 - otherwise make sure to apply the ARIA patterns, to ensure correct semantics

testID-066.title: An interactive component does not have an accessible name
testID-066.detail: An interactive component does not have an accessible name
testID-066.solution:
Prefer native methods by providing a button label.
 If needed, the accessible name can be modified using the ARIA attributes aria-label and aria-labelledby.
